revised_title: Experimental Investigation of Initial Flame Acceleration in Explosive Gas Mixtures
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the initial phase of flame acceleration in stoichiometric hydrogen-oxygen mixtures. They observed the generation of pressure waves at the flame front and the development of the flow field ahead of the flame. The results showed that the transition from a wrinkled laminar to a turbulent flame significantly influenced the process of flame acceleration. The findings provide valuable information for understanding the formation of detonation waves in gaseous media.
